author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
Party is keen to make Nitish vs Modi in 2019 Lok Sabha polls

Buoyed with the big win in the last Bihar Assembly election , the ruling party JD(U) now is all set to make a revamp in the party while looking at the 2019 Lok Sabha polls.

The party is likely to induct more and more young leaders in its organisational structure with the old and experienced one taking important roles at higher level.

To give the final shape of the revamped party organization a high-level meeting of party leaders had taken place at Chief Minister Nitish Kumar’s official residence on Wednesday.

At the meeting the party also approved the decision to go for a change in the party symbol.

“Yes, we met to discuss our plan to give the party a new fresh look with a mix of experienced leaders and relatively younger ones from all sections of the society. The young leaders of the party now would shoulder more responsibility in the party organisation”, said State JD)U) president Basistha Narayan Singh.
title: JD(U) set for big revamp
